titleStmt.title: To WILLIAM POWELL FRITH,William Powell Frith (1819-1909; Dictionary of National Biography), painter. Studied art at the Royal Academy schools. Exhibited at the British Institution 1839; at the Royal Academy 1840; ARA 1845; RA 1853. Painted several pictures of Dolly Varden in 1841 (after the publication of Barnaby Rudge), after which he became a friend of CD. John Forster commissioned the portrait Charles Dickens in His Study from him in 1859. 16 MAY 1864

body.p: The enclosed requisitionPrepared by CD for a meeting of the Garrick Club on 25 Apr 1864, to amend the rules for committee member retirement and re-election. In the end the resolution was not used; see To Lover, 21 May 1864, Pilgrim Letters 10, pp. 397-8. (which speaks for itself as a plain matter) will require 20 signatures. Do you feel a sufficient interest in such a principle, to authorize me to add yours to it? You can tell me on Wednesday, and then give it me back.
